provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. When any person entitled to any freehold land by E n p of
way of mortgage has or shall have departed this life, and of   satlsfaction
his executor or administrator is or shall be entitled to the
money secured by the mortgage, and the legal estate in
such land is or shall be vested in the heir or devisee of such
mortgagee, or the heir, devisee, or other assign of such heir
or devisee, and possession of the land shall not have been
taken by virtue of the mortgage, nor any action or suit be
depending, such executor or administrator shall have
power, upon payment of the principal money and interest
due to him on the said mortgage to enter satisfaction in
the margin of the record of the said mortgage, in the
Record Office,or otherwise to convey by deed or surrender
(as the case may require) the legal estate which became
vested in such heir or devisee; and such entry of satisfac-
tion or conveyance shall be as effectual as if the same had
been made by any such heir or devisee, his heirs or assigns.
